Fix getting the module parent of a module.
Don’t remove the listener for Request.GET_PARENT_FLEX_MODULE_FACTORY_REQUEST when the module is unloaded. We want to be able to traverse the parent chain and check which rsls have been loaded.
Changed the listener to a weak listener so we can leave it active.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
ModuleManager keeps weak references to modules
The ModuleManager now keeps weak references to modules. Modules do not need to be unloaded to be garbage collected, being removed from the display list is enough.

I also removed the “limbo” variable since the module is already in a weak reference dictionary. This change introduces a small change in behavior that should not be problematic. After calling release() a module can appear as “ready” and “loaded” whereas before the module would not appear as “ready” or “loaded”. This is because the module is still in memory with its old state. Calling load() on one of these modules results in all the module lifecycle events being dispatched, the only difference is the module did not need to be loaded. So I don’t think this change will cause any developers a problem.
Developers who are expecting the ModuleManager to keep modules in memory for them without keeping a reference to IModuleInfo will see their modules get garbage collected.
